introduction.title: Introduction
introduction.content: Sri Lanka, known as the 'Pearl of the Indian Ocean,' is a tropical paradise with diverse wildlife. From iconic elephants to elusive leopards, its national parks like Yala and Wilpattu are crucial for conservation. The island's lush landscapes echo with the sounds of a vibrant ecosystem, while its oceans teem with marine life. Beyond ecological importance, Sri Lanka's wildlife holds cultural significance, woven into indigenous beliefs and folk tales. The nation's commitment to conservation ensures the preservation of this extraordinary natural heritage.
